snippet: There’s a rink, two bull’s-eye targets and smooth stones to slide. But there are also brooms and a lot of yelling, and strategy.
abstract: Editorial urges readers to support curling, one of the last sports in the Olympics not overrun by professionals; observes that curling in the summer is a cheap way for amateurs to pick up the game; directs readers to the Long Island Curling Club, which hosts periodic open houses.
